meanings.definition: A material that has a permanent electric charge.
meanings.sent1: The electret attracted small pieces of paper due to its electric charge.
meanings.sent2: The electret in the microphone helped convert sound waves into electrical signals.
meanings.sent3: The electret walked into the room, causing all the balloons to stick to it.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was like an electret, always leaving a lasting impression on everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The electret glowed softly in the dark, a constant reminder of its electric charge.

meanings.definition: To treat or coat a material to give it a permanent electric charge.
meanings.sent1: He decided to electret the fabric to make it repel dust more effectively.
meanings.sent2: The scientist carefully electreted the surface of the metal to enhance its conductivity.
meanings.sent3: The magician electreted his hat, causing it to attract coins magically.
meanings.sent4: She electreted her words with positivity, leaving a lasting impact on her audience.
meanings.sent5: The artist electreted the paintbrush, creating beautiful electric patterns on the canvas.
